intro: Pseudostellaria cashmiriana, commonly known as Kashmir starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, including parts of India, Nepal, and Pakistan. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
